com.github.wuic.nut

Class CompositeNut

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.wuic.nut.AbstractNut
      • com.github.wuic.nut.AbstractConvertibleNut
        • com.github.wuic.nut.PipedConvertibleNut
          • com.github.wuic.nut.CompositeNut
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ConvertibleNut, Nut

    public class CompositeNut
extends PipedConvertibleNut

    A composite Nut is able to chain all the stream provided by each element of the composition. We consider that all the nuts of the composition should have the same state (name, etc).

    Since:
    0.4.2
    Version:
    1.2
    Author:
    Guillaume DROUET

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  CompositeNut.Combiner
      This class combines different sets of nuts as specified by mergeNuts(ProcessContext, List) It ensures that every names will be unique in returned lists during the entire lifecycle of its instance.
      class  CompositeNut.CompositeInputStream
      This class keeps the position of each nut in the read content.

            byte[] separator,
            ProcessContext processContext,
            ConvertibleNut... composition)

        Builds a new instance.

        Parameters:
        avn - indicates if version computation is done asynchronously or not
        composition - the nuts of this composition
        separator - the bytes between each stream, null if nothing
        specificName - the name of the composition
        processContext - the process context

    • Method Detail

      • getAsynchronousVersionNumber

        public Boolean getAsynchronousVersionNumber()

        Indicates if version number is computed asynchronously.

        Returns:
        true if asynchronous operation is performed, false otherwise

      • isDynamic

        public boolean isDynamic()

        Indicates if this nut has a dynamic content, meaning that it could be changed each time Nut.openStream() is invoked. In this case the nut should not be added to any cache and transformation chain should be applied.

        Specified by:
        isDynamic in interface Nut
        Overrides:
        isDynamic in class AbstractConvertibleNut
        Returns:
        true if content is dynamic, false otherwise

      • transform

        public void transform(Pipe.OnReady... onReady)
               throws IOException

        Transforms the source stream with all registered transformers and calls the given callback in addition to callbacks previously registered. The method also writes the result to the given output stream.

        Specified by:
        transform in interface ConvertibleNut
        Overrides:
        transform in class PipedConvertibleNut
        Parameters:
        onReady - the callback
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • mergeNuts

        public static List<ConvertibleNut> mergeNuts(ProcessContext processContext,
                             List<ConvertibleNut> nuts)

        Merges all sequences nuts with the same name into one CompositeNut. When a stream is read in a composite object, a composite InputStream is returned and will read each stream in the order of the list. When a composition is created, its name is prefixed with the its position in the given list.

        For instance, ['foo.js', 'foo.js', 'bar.css', 'baz.js', 'foo.js'] => ['0foo.js', 'bar.css', 'baz.js', 'foo.js'] where the first element is a composition and where "prefixCountStart" equals to 0.

        Parameters:
        processContext - the process context
        nuts - the nuts to merge
        Returns:
        a list containing all the nuts with some compositions
